Plot: Harry becomes manager of a tag team of gorgeous lady wrestlers. On the road, they endure a number of indignities, including bad motels, small-time crooks and a mud-wrestling match, while trying to reach Reno for a big event at the MGM Grand.
Reception: In his October 16, 1981, review in The New York Times, the film critic Vincent Canby singled out Falk for "one of his best performances".
Production: Second unit photography began 5 November 1980. Principal photography took place 14 November to 24 February 1981 on location in Youngstown, Akron Ohio, Chicago, Las Vegas, Reno and Los Angeles.[2]
starring: Peter Falk Vicki Frederick Laurene Landon Burt Young Tracy Reed
